intro: Aegialina tenuis, commonly known as the slender sea nettle, is a marine species belonging to the family Rhizostomidae. It is a type of jellyfish characterized by its transparent, bell-shaped body and long, delicate tentacles. This species is typically found in coastal waters, where it thrives in the intertidal zone. Aegialina tenuis has a simple anatomy, lacking a true medusa stage, and reproduces through sexual reproduction in the open ocean. Its ecological role includes serving as prey for various marine animals and contributing to the nutrient cycle in coastal ecosystems.
